question: Which Indian swimmer becomes world's youngest and first Asian swimmer to complete Ocean 7 Challenge recently?
explanation: Rohan More, a Pune-based swimmer, has become the world's youngest and first Asian swimmer to complete the Ocean Seven Challenge. The Ocean Seven Challenge is to cross seven of the world's toughest ocean channels comprising a distance of nearly 200 km. The Ocean Seven Challenge covers the North Channel, the Cook Strait, the Molokai Channel, the English Channel, the Catalina Channel, the Tsugaru Strait and the Strait of Gibraltar. He is the ninth swimmer on the whole to complete the Ocean 7 Challenge.
